title: Cryptanalysis on HMAC/NMAC-MD5 and MD5-MAC.
abstract: In this paper, we present the first distinguishing attack on HMAC and NMAC based on MD5 without related keys, which distinguishes the HMAC/NMAC-MD5 from HMAC/NMAC with a random function. The attack needs 297 queries, with a success probability 0.87, while the previous distinguishing attack on HMAC-MD5 reduced to 33 rounds takes 2126.1 messages with a success rate of 0.92. Furthermore, we give distinguishing and partial key recovery attacks on MD x  -MAC based on MD5. The MD x  -MAC was proposed by Preneel and van Oorschot in Crypto'95 which uses three subkeys derived from the initial key. We are able to recover one 128-bit subkey with 297 queries.
